title: Ticket #889: Split up the WriteUserLog class
description:
Synopsis

Currently, the WriteUserLog class has several issues:

  1. There's a lot of duplicate logic to accommodate the addition of the event log
  2. For the schedd, which likely has a lot of WriteUserLog objects, there are man open file handles to the event log file.
  3. This intertwining of these functions has increased the complexity of the code, making it increasingly more difficult to maintain.

Fixes

To fix this, I propose:
  1. Split up WriteUserLog into a base class, and two thin derived classes
    1. WriteUserLogBase would be the class with logic shared between the "normal" user log and event log
    2. WriteUserLog would be very small, containing only logic specific to the user log.
      • Included in this would be a static pointer to a singleton WriteEventLog object
    3. WriteEventLog would contain all of the event log specific logic'
      • As noted above, there would be only a single instance of this object, with pointers to it shared by all of the WriteUserLog objects
    4. The pointer to the WriteEventLog singleton would be available to the application through a static accessor method in the WriteUserLog class
  2. The schedd would thus be able to directly interact with the WriteEventLog object
    1. In particular, it would disable reconfigure events from being propagated through the WriteUserLog objects to the WriteEventLog object, and would instead directly reconfigure the WriteEventLog object.
